beforeCommit.message:
Refactor HiveWriterFactory#getWriterParameters

Split this method into smaller once as it is too large and hard to
follow and maintain.

afterCommit.message:
Optimize metastore communication when writing to partitioned table

Avoid unnecesary metastore calls on Presto workers when writing to
a partitioned table.

Generally it is required to get the partition information on the worker
to figure out the storage format and other partition parameters.

However if the partitions are immutable the append is not supported, thus
the information about the underlying storage format of a partition is not
needed.

However the getPartition call is still needed to check if the partition
exist. As in case when overwrite is not allowed we would like to fail fast.

Given the number of extra metastore calls it results into it feels like
it is not reasonable price to pay for fail fast for this non very common
case.

If the direct write into the destination partition is required (with no
staging directory) the old model should stay in place, as it is the only
way to avoid adding files into the folder of an immutable partition.

nodes.bodyText:
The method calling this already calculating it differently? 522248f#diff-bd92d40b327dea510bb55e3f197aa911R302
Seems like we can either generate it from the name or from the column values. Would be nice to be consistent and not do it twice?
If they are are enabled by default then isn't what the test needs to do the inverse? It needs test with the optimized writers disabled?

Why does this have to include partitions being appended to? Seems like we don't use this in the append path.
Are there cases where we will attempt to append and also overwrite/new?
Yeah maybe let's remove this line break.
The only concern I have is that this seems to change the default behavior and I'm not sure if we want to start with setting the default value to true.

commit.message:
Refactor HiveWriterFactory#createWriter

The method is way too large. It is hard to make any changes to it.

Refactor HiveWriterFactory#getWriterParameters

Split this method into smaller once as it is too large and hard to
follow and maintain.

Refactor TestHiveIntegrationSmokeTest

Optimized writers for ORC and RC file are enabled by default, thus
there's not need to enable them explicitly in the smoke test
Add smoke test for insert into immutable partition

Optimize metastore communication when writing to partitioned table

Avoid unnecesary metastore calls on Presto workers when writing to
a partitioned table.

Generally it is required to get the partition information on the worker
to figure out the storage format and other partition parameters.

However if the partitions are immutable the append is not supported, thus
the information about the underlying storage format of a partition is not
needed.

However the getPartition call is still needed to check if the partition
exist. As in case when overwrite is not allowed we would like to fail fast.

Given the number of extra metastore calls it results into it feels like
it is not reasonable price to pay for fail fast for this non very common
case.

If the direct write into the destination partition is required (with no
staging directory) the old model should stay in place, as it is the only
way to avoid adding files into the folder of an immutable partition.
